channel.title: USPTO All Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO All events.

item.title: K-12 education office hours
Trademark Public Advisory Committee executive session
item.description: Activity Speaker Deliberative discussions regarding pre-decisional confidential information related to USPTO strategic planning and potential recommendations, and discussions on future budget planning of Trademark fees and USPTO operations. David Cho, TPAC Chair

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part IV: Learn how to draft a patent application
Learn how to make a smooth transition to Patent Center
Intellectual Property Basics and Helpful Resources
One-day patents boot camp
Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. Watch the public session virtually on Webex (TBD). The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled public meeting.

item.title: Intellectual property basics for National Veterans Small Business Week
item.description: Learn about intellectual property (IP) basics and ways to protect your innovations as you transition from idea to product during this webinar for National Veterans Small Business Week. This virtual event, happening November 3 at 11 a.m. CT and hosted in coordination with the Veterans Business Outreach Center at Mississippi State University, is free for veterans and military spouses.

item.title: One-day trademarks boot camp
Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 6: Responding to an office action
One-day patents boot camp
The Path to a Patent, Part V: Understanding the role of claims in a patent application
Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 7: Keeping your registration alive
SOaR webinar: Hague applications for international design protection
item.description: Are you interested in protecting your design in multiple countries? If so, please join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) on Tuesday, November 14, from 3-4:30 p.m. ET, for a free virtual webinar on the benefits of filing Hague applications for international design protection.

item.title: A fireside chat with USPTO patent examiners
item.description: Come join us for a laid back and informational fireside chat that will give you an inside look at being a patent examiner at the USPTO. You will get the opportunity to engage in insightful conversations and get answers to your questions directly from team members.

item.title: China IP: Quarterly legislation and case law update
Getting started with Patent Public Search
Fireside Chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims
item.description: Join the next Patent Trial and Appeal Board Boardside Chat webinar on Thursday, November 16, from noon to 1 p.m. ET, for a fireside chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims. Judge Holte will discuss the jurisdiction and types of cases handled by the Court of Federal Claims, procedures used in those cases, and best practices when appearing before the court.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VI: Learn how to protect your IP abroad
One-day patents boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day patents boot camp on November 16 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET at Gateway Area Development District in Morehead, Kentucky. This in-person, single-day workshop is for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and inventors in communities with limited or no internet access, covering tools, techniques, and resources to understand the patent application process.

item.title: Coming to New Orleans November 17: Women's entrepreneurship
One-day trademarks boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on November 18, 2023 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CT with Build Bronzeville SBDC at Quad Communities Development Corporation (QCDC) in Chicago, Illinois. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and start-ups in communities with limited or no internet access, covering what they should know about trademarks.

item.title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 8: Question-and-answer panel
K-12 education office hours
Patent Public Advisory Committee public meeting
item.description: Attend the next public meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) to learn more about patent-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. You can watch the virtual public session via WebEx. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VII: How to file a patent application using Patent Center
The Path to a Patent, Part VIII: Common mistakes and post-filing support
Intellectual Property Basics and Helpful Resources
A day in the life of a USPTO patent examiner
item.description: Do you want a challenging career? Would you like the opportunity to work from home nationwide with a flexible schedule? Do you want to be a part of a culture of inclusivity and camaraderie, and a community that leads America toward breakthroughs in innovation? Are you a U.S. citizen graduating this year with a focus in any of these fields? Biology Biomedical Engineering Chemistry Chemical Engineering Computer Engineering Computer Science Design Electrical Engineering Mechanical Engineering Physics If you answered yes to any of these questions, you may belong at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner! We recruit the most promising at America's Innovation Agency, and we encourage you to take the step forward in your journey today by joining us on December 11 at noon ET for an informational webinar on becoming a patent examiner.
